I have a theory and this is just a theory,  that as the beads get closer to the ground they slow down slightly, while the beads higher from the ground continue at there regularly velocity in relation to their height. The beads then press up against each other due to this small  difference in velocity ,and because of the rugged flexibility of the beads when the arch is formed and with its ability to flow smoothly as it falls and kicks itself up , the height of the arch is able to rise due to forces from both directions towards the arch.
